intro: Acianthera ramosa, commonly known as the branched acianthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
